title: Arthritis: Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
description:
Arthritis is a term often used to mean any disorder that affects joints. Symptoms generally include joint pain and stiffness. Other symptoms may include redness, warmth, swelling, and decreased range of motion of the affected joints. In some types other organs are also affected.[6] Onset can be gradual or sudden 
There are over 100 types of arthritis. The most common forms are osteoarthritis (degenerative joint disease) and rheumatoid arthritis. Osteoarthritis usually occurs with age and affects the fingers, knees, and hips. Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disorder that often affects the hands and feet. Other types include gout, lupus, fibromyalgia, and septic arthritis. They are all types of rheumatic disease. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Arthritis symptoms, Arthritis management, Arthritis causes, Arthritis diagnosis, Arthritis Prognosis, Arthritis Epidemiology and history. 
Here are features that make this app better than all other Arthritis Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free. 

==========================
SAY HELLO
==========================
Any medical information published on this app is not intended as a substitute for informed medical advice and you should not take any action before consulting with a healthcare professional. Our team are nonstop working hard on creation this app. Please feel free to review and email us for any questions/suggestions/complications. If you have liked any feature and information of this app, please do not forget to rate us on play store. title: Arthritis Tracker
description:
Created with young people for young people, Arthritis Tracker lets you rate your symptoms in seconds and see a summary of your recent pain, sore joints (e.g. knee, fingers, hands), medication side effects, energy levels, activity, sleep and emotions. 

You can use these summaries to help you talk to your healthcare professionals at medical appointments or simply to see how you‚Äôve been doing recently.

With Arthritis Tracker, you can also:
-learn how to handle your symptoms, your flare-ups, manage your stress, and reduce the impact that arthritis has on your daily life 
-get tips on talking to other people about your arthritis
-find out how you can manage your condition alongside your school or university coursework and exams
-read stories from other young people with arthritis and get inspired by their experiences and advice 
-get trusted information about juvenile idiopathic arthritis
-find information about Versus Arthritis events coming up in the UK
-learn how to connect with Versus Arthritis and get support online.

Arthritis Tracker is designed for young people aged 13 to 25, and Versus Arthritis is always working to incorporate young people‚Äôs ideas about how to make the app better. Learn more about the improvements we‚Äôve made here: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker

Healthcare professionals who treat people with juvenile idiopathic arthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus or other inflammatory conditions (e.g. rheumatologists, rheumatology teams) can order leaflets for their clinics and get ideas about how to use Arthritis Tracker during health appointments. Visit Versus Arthritis for more information: www.versusarthritis.org/arthritis-tracker-health-professionals

description:
Reverse Rheumatoid Arthritis symptoms naturally with the Paddison Program, the world‚Äôs most trusted and reliable approach to minimizing inflammatory arthritis conditions. title: My Arthritis
description:
My Arthritis Care is a clinician-approved, patient-designed app for patients with the following conditions:

	‚Ä¢	Rheumatoid Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Psoriatic Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Enteropathic Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Ankylosing Spondylitis
	‚Ä¢	Osteoarthritis
	‚Ä¢	Osteoporosis
	‚Ä¢	Undifferentiated Arthritis
	‚Ä¢	Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
	‚Ä¢	Sjogren‚Äôs syndrome
	‚Ä¢	Vasculitis
	‚Ä¢	Scleroderma
	‚Ä¢	Behcet‚Äôs syndrome
	‚Ä¢	Sarcoidosis. 

The app - and its clinician-focused counterpart, HealthSuite - helps patients take control of their condition and improve their health outcomes.

Anyone can use the app to 
	‚Ä¢	track flares and maintain a symptom log to identify what may be causing them
	‚Ä¢	manage your care plan, medication and hospital/GP appointments
	‚Ä¢	access and share your medical records from anywhere
	‚Ä¢	obtain advice and discover local events organised by leading patient groups
	‚Ä¢	access useful information from National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society

Patients whose clinical teams have signed up can also
	‚Ä¢	communicate with their care teams via messaging and phone
	‚Ä¢	report symptoms remotely, allowing care teams to intervene early as required

The app was co-developed with leading academics and clinicians at Kings College Hospital, with inputs from patients and patient groups.

We‚Äôre committed to continuously improving our service to make it more useful to patients and clinicians, so please look out for regular updates.

comments: I have been using it for one week, entering notes and have medication reminder set up. It was simple to use BUT now the app crashes on launch... So I lost all my notes..

I was frequently diagnosed with RA, a lot of medications, appointments, blood tests and exercises were thrown at me. I have had such a hard time keeping track of my medications and appointments and this app helps me keep everything organized in one place. It reminds me to take my medications on time, when my next appointment Is and keep track of my condition. The app includes articles that give useful tips, based on your condition. If you have any form of arthritis this app helps a lot.
I downloaded this a couple of weeks ago. It's easy to use and helps me keep track of my symptoms and medication, especially as I have just started on new injections.
You fill in your details and get pin . On entering email and pin goes back to sign up or sign in screen. Every time I try to log in.

title: RA Monitor
description:
The first Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) monitoring app that connects you to your specialist presents a clean interface and informative reporting. More than just an intuitive tool for tracking your symptoms, their impact on your ability to function, and triggers, RA Monitor allows you to access the support of your specialist (or our RA Navigator) and the anonymous community of other RA sufferers that you can interact with if you choose. Easy-to-read reports can be shared with others, such as family, friends or your healthcare providers. Get daily information that helps get your RA under control, such as news, tips, and inspirations. Designed in concert with RPM Healthcare‚Äôs founders' 35+ years of patient education expertise.

Features:
-Free app for arthritis!
-Highly intuitive RA Symptoms Tracker (Location, function impairment, weather, menstrual cycle, stress)
-Medication Tracker (including effectiveness)
-Trigger Tracker
-Easy to register and get started quickly
-Connect to your specialist (or our RA Navigator)‚Äîallows healthcare providers to follow your progress between visits. Change providers when you choose.
-Anonymous social networking with other people with RA
-Edit entries for any day using a calendar portal
-Ability to share your symptoms, medication, and trigger reports
-Automatic weather data for analysis
-Detailed reports and insights screen

recentChanges: Improvements
comments: I have just installed this app but have been doing my own tracking until now. I am not sure if I can add retrospectively but before I even try I can't see how to change date to British convention and daily temperature to centigrade. Is this possible as I can't see it in settings. These are musts for me. Thanks.

Detailed record for all aspects of your condition, feelings, abilities etc. Takes time and would be better if you could do multiple joints especially in hands. When my hands are bad its hard work selecting each individual joints to log they hurt while making then hurt typing.
It's ok. I'd like to be able to record the times I take meds.

It would be helpful if multiple joints could be selected at the same time when logging symptoms, sometimes when dexterity is more limited, selecting the individual joints and manually documenting is difficult. A food diary would be great too, too track things like gluten, dairy and nightshades

There's a pop up or a bug that is making editing previous days rather difficult. I like this app otherwise. I'd also like to copy and paste symptoms from previous days or copy symptoms from one side and paste it to the other side. I typically have the same issues in both sides and it would be nice to save me extra taps.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet
description:
Foods that are rich to contaminate the ill-effects of Rheumatoid Arthritis include:

1. Fiber-rich fruits and vegetables
The diet should focus on fiber-rich fruits and vegetables since it helps to bring down the CRP (C-reactive protein) blood level. CRP plays an active role in increasing inflammation problems. It is a major source to cure the symptoms and promote a healthier life. The antioxidants present in the fruits and vegetables take active part in stabilizing free radical molecules that are responsible for damaging human cells.

2. Extra-virgin olive oil
Extra-virgin olive oil is the best way to replace the consumption of drugs like aspirin and ibuprofen. Within these oils, there is an oleocanthal component present which takes an active participating in blocking the enzymes resulting in inflammation. The consumption of olive oil must be taken keeping in view that it doesn‚Äôt result in weight gain.

3. Peas, beans, and nuts
Peas and beans are a great source of protein which is a must to be present in every diet plan. People suffering from rheumatoid arthritis are likely to lose muscle strength. With the protein-rich diet, muscle health is also supported. For protecting any heart problems, nuts are the best option. It could include hazelnuts, almonds, pistachios, and pine nuts.

4. Fish oil
If you‚Äôre looking to get relief from tender joints, then fish oil is the best solution. The early morning stiffness can be eliminated with the consumption of fish oil in the Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet. It helps to get rid of a certain amount of medications. With its consumption, a human body gets the essential omega-3 fatty acids to cure the health condition. The consumption of fish oil should remain within a suitable dosage as high doses may come in an interaction with the drugs consumed during medication and result in high blood pressure.

5. Cold-water fish
The cold-water fishes are a great product for a balanced Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet. It could include tuna, trout, halibut, anchovies, salmon, mackerel, and herring. Breakfast can be done with white fish or lox. Prepare salads from shrimp or crab and a flounder sandwich could be a great option for the meal. The omega-3 fatty acids present in fish is not easily found in any other product. These anti-inflammatory foods are rich for curing the arthritis symptoms.

What are the foods to avoid for Rheumatoid Arthritis?

There exist certain foods that may worsen the health condition and leads to joint or muscle pains. The foods to be removed from your diet include:


1. Meat
Meat is a disaster for a health condition as it contains high saturated fats, which opens the way to inflammation in the body. It also results in obesity problems.

2. Sugar
It is a must that one must maintain a proper blood sugar level in the arthritis problems. The sugar foods or sweet drinks can raise the blood sugar levels in the body which produces cytokines. Cytokines are the chemicals that result in inflammation problems and joint pains.

3. Gluten
Gluten is mostly found in barley or wheat and is a must to be avoided. It results in severe joint pressures and also causes an autoimmune disorder. This disorder is a major factor resulting in celiac diseases.  

4. Alcohol
The effect of alcohol is not easily treatable by the medications also. Its consumption, lower down the progression of arthritis condition. The C-reactive protein present in it is a powerful source of inflammatory problems.


With this article, one gets a clear view of the foods to consume and avoid in the diet. It is a must that a well-balanced diet must be followed to see good results.
In this application you will find:

‚Ä¢	Foods That Can Help RA Symptoms
‚Ä¢	Nutrition Guidelines for People With Rheumatoid Arthritis
‚Ä¢	Tips for Living with Rheumatoid Arthritis
‚Ä¢	Nutrition & Rheumatoid Arthritis
‚Ä¢	Much, much more about Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet.

Download this app now and get Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet.

2. Extra-virgin olive oil
Extra-virgin olive oil is the best way to replace the consumption of drugs like aspirin and ibuprofen. Within these oils, there is an oleocanthal component present which takes an active participating in blocking the enzymes resulting in inflammation. The consumption of olive oil must be taken keeping in view that it doesn‚Äôt result in weight gain.

3. Peas, beans, and nuts
Peas and beans are a great source of protein which is a must to be present in every diet plan. People suffering from rheumatoid arthritis are likely to lose muscle strength. With the protein-rich diet, muscle health is also supported. For protecting any heart problems, nuts are the best option. It could include hazelnuts, almonds, pistachios, and pine nuts.

4. Fish oil
If you‚Äôre looking to get relief from tender joints, then fish oil is the best solution. The early morning stiffness can be eliminated with the consumption of fish oil in the Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet. It helps to get rid of a certain amount of medications. With its consumption, a human body gets the essential omega-3 fatty acids to cure the health condition. The consumption of fish oil should remain within a suitable dosage as high doses may come in an interaction with the drugs consumed during medication and result in high blood pressure.

5. Cold-water fish
The cold-water fishes are a great product for a balanced Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet. It could include tuna, trout, halibut, anchovies, salmon, mackerel, and herring. Breakfast can be done with white fish or lox. Prepare salads from shrimp or crab and a flounder sandwich could be a great option for the meal. The omega-3 fatty acids present in fish is not easily found in any other product. These anti-inflammatory foods are rich for curing the arthritis symptoms.

What are the foods to avoid for Rheumatoid Arthritis?

There exist certain foods that may worsen the health condition and leads to joint or muscle pains. The foods to be removed from your diet include:


1. Meat
Meat is a disaster for a health condition as it contains high saturated fats, which opens the way to inflammation in the body. It also results in obesity problems.

2. Sugar
It is a must that one must maintain a proper blood sugar level in the arthritis problems. The sugar foods or sweet drinks can raise the blood sugar levels in the body which produces cytokines. Cytokines are the chemicals that result in inflammation problems and joint pains.

3. Gluten
Gluten is mostly found in barley or wheat and is a must to be avoided. It results in severe joint pressures and also causes an autoimmune disorder. This disorder is a major factor resulting in celiac diseases.

4. Alcohol
The effect of alcohol is not easily treatable by the medications also. Its consumption, lower down the progression of arthritis condition. The C-reactive protein present in it is a powerful source of inflammatory problems.


With this article, one gets a clear view of the foods to consume and avoid in the diet. It is a must that a well-balanced diet must be followed to see good results.

‚Ä¢ Nutrition & Rheumatoid Arthritis
‚Ä¢ Much, much more about Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet.

Download this app now and get Rheumatoid Arthritis Diet.

title: Arthritis Treatment
description:
Arthritis is a joint disorder featuring inflammation. A joint is an area of the body where two different bones meet. A joint functions to move the body parts connected by its bones. Arthritis literally means inflammation of one or more joints.
Arthritis is inflammation in and around the body‚Äôs joints. Some types of arthritis include but are not limited to osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis and gout. 
However, arthritis affects people in all age groups, including almost 300,000 children. 
The goals of treatment are to increase joint mobility and strength and help patients learn to manage pain.
Arthritis is frequently accompanied by joint pain. Joint pain is referred to as arthralgia. When four or more joints are involved, the arthritis is referred to as polyarthritis. 
When two or three joints are involved, it is referred to as oligoarthritis. When only a single joint is involved, it is referred to as monoarthritis.
Osteoarthritis¬†is the most common type of arthritis. When the cartilage  the slick, cushioning surface on the ends of bones  wears away, bone rubs against bone, causing pain, swelling and stiffness. 
Over time, joints can lose strength and pain may become chronic. Risk factors include excess weight, family history, age and previous injury.
DWONLOAD this App for free to know more about Arthritis symptoms, Arthritis causes and Arthritis treatement and rheumatologist Diagnosis .

title: ArthritisPower
description: The ArthritisPower registry was developed to empower people with arthritis, bone, autoimmune, and inflammatory skin diseases to fight back by participating in real-world, patient-centric research. With this app, you will be able to track YOUR symptoms, health and wellness using surveys, completing validated patient reporting outcomes questionnaires and using data captured by your phone (biosensor data) to monitor well-being. ArthritisPower enables participants to also track medications, medical history and to share health information with care providers, family members, etc. at their discretion. ArthritisPower has the ability to run on a smartphone App and on the web for PCs, giving participants the ability to stay connected whenever they want. Come join the fight and help others as you help yourself, track your health and use your data to help combat joint, bone and skin diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, psoriasis, psoriatic arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, lupus, gout and other conditions.

title: Osteoarthritis Joint Pain Treatment Home Remedies
description:
In this app we have tried compiling information on causes symptoms treatment prevention home remedies foods to eat and avoid for osteoarthritis. Osteoarthritis, the most common form of arthritis caused by cartilage degeneration, is affecting many people worldwide especially the older age.

The most common symptom of osteoarthritis is pain in the affected joint or joints but other osteoarthritis symptoms and signs include
* swollen joints
* joint stiffness
* joint creaking
* loss of range of motion
Osteoarthritis commonly affects hands, feet, spine, and the large weight-bearing joints, such as the hips and knees but any joint in the body can be affected.
Although it is not a diseases but just a natural ageing of the joints and can be hereditary too. Certain conditions like obesity, diabetes, gout, hormone disorders are also associated with secondary osteoarthritis. There is no blood test performed for the diagnosis of osteoarthritis.

This app provides you complete information on the osteoarthritis !!

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Treatment Guidelines
description:
Rheumatoid Arthritis Treatment Learning, One cause of arthritis is an autoimmune disease that forces the body to enter a self-preservation routine that subsequently attacks healthy tissues. The body, due to this disease, believes the healthy tissues are a threat to it. There is no known cause of the autoimmune disease but some information on rheumatoid arthritis cites environmental factors as a possible cause. Viruses including bacteria and fungus are also factors in its development. Information of Rheumatoid Arthritis: Treatments, focuses on the treatments of the disease rather than the cause.

Learn More About:

- rheumatoid arthritis symptoms	
- rheumatoid arthritis causes	
- rheumatoid arthritis diagnosis

Rheumatoid arthritis is different to osteoarthritis, which tends to affect older people as a degenerative disease. Information on rheumatoid arthritis suggests that it can attack not only cartilage in the joints, but also bones as well. When pain related to arthritis is experiences, it can be difficult to identify the exact root of the problem, but thorough diagnosis by a doctor will determine if the pain is the result of a natural progression of lost cartilage or an internal strike from the body's immune system.

Constant repetition of the inflammation of bone tissue can cause the pain in the joint to come and go, making a full diagnosis difficult. Additional exploratory x-rays and CAT-scans are often needed to help find out the cause of the pain. Of the information on rheumatoid arthritis that we have available, it implies that the degeneration can cause is symmetrical, for example, if one hand is affected, the other hand will be too.

If you want learn about Rheumatoid Arthritis Treatment, download this app.

title: Arthritis Gout Uric Acid Diet
description:
Arthritis Gout Uric Acid Diet is a free app containing information about gout arthritis or high uric acid disease symptoms causes treatment diet & food tips. Gout is a kind of arthritis caused by a high buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints. Uric acid is a breakdown product of purines that are part of many foods we eat.
crystallization of uric acid compounds in joints can cause painful attack of arthritis, kidney stones, and if not treated carefully may also cause blockage of the kidney filtering tubules with uric acid crystals, leading to kidney failure.
The small joint at the base of the big toe is the most common site for an attack.
Other joints that can be affected include the ankles, knees, wrists, fingers, and elbows. In some patients the acute pain is so intense that even a bed sheet touching the toe causes severe pain. People may experience gout with deposits of uric acid crystals in their finger joints.

Obesity, excessive weight gain, moderate to heavy alcoholconsumption, high blood pressure, and abnormal kidney function are among the common risk factors for developing gout. Certain drugs and diseases can also cause increased levels of uric acid. Also,hypothyroidism patients are at increased risk of developing gout.
Eating healthy diet and living a healthy lifestyle may help cope with the situation.
Patients with the high blood uric acid levels are restricted of eating a high protein diet because the purine content in foods like pulses, red meats, full cream dairy products are high. They should strictly avoid organ meats.
Maintaining adequate fluid intake or drinking plenty of water and healthy fluids help prevent gout attacks and decreases the risk of kidney stone formation in people with gout.
Foods rich in vitamin C like lemon, tangerines, oranges also helps in lowering the uric acid levels.
So eat a healthy and balanced diet, do regular exercising, give proper rest to the site of gout attack.

title: Knee Arthritis Exercises
description:
Our mobile app shows exercises for knee arthritis. Performing these movements regularly reduces symptoms such as knee pain, edema and stiffness.

Exercise is important in patients with knee calcification for the following reasons;

* Knee exercises maintain the entire range of motion of the joint.

* Strengthens the muscles supporting the knee joint.

* Reduces knee pain and absorbs shock from adding strong muscles.

You can easily make these movements at home or in the office. Knee pain exercises are practical, you don't waste much time and do not need special equipment. Although calcification does not completely disappear, knee arthritis exercises help to reduce symptoms such as pain.

title: Qigong for Arthritis Relief
description:
Stream or download qigong video lessons to heal your Arthritis symptoms permanently. 
‚Ä¢ Get immediate pain relief for your arthritis.
‚Ä¢ New smaller app size!
‚Ä¢ Learn to use qigong to promote healing.
In this hour-long video app, Master Yang presents gentle qigong exercises to help ease your Arthritis pain and speed your body‚Äôs natural healing. The exercises are simple to learn and enjoyable to practice, and you can easily follow along with Dr. Yang's demonstration. The movements can be practiced sitting or standing. 
In the second half of the program, Dr. Yang offers pain-relieving massage techniques for yourself and with a partner, and shows important pressure points, or acupuncture cavities. A complete self-massage section is included which you may follow along to.  Massage is sometimes necessary to help improve your circulation to speed the healing process.
Whether you want to prevent Arthritis or are suffering from joint pain already, qigong can help you with pain relief and stimulate your healing. For centuries, the Chinese have healed and strengthened their bodies with Qigong (chee-kung), the art of using the mind to direct the energy within your body to improve health and vitality. This program also gives an introduction to the general concepts of qigong and how it pertains to arthritis.
"Qigong for Arthritis Relief" by Dr. Yang, Jwing-Ming is also available as a DVD, book or ebook. 

Learn details about posture, the Qi (energy) circulatory system, and how to properly practice Qigong to improve your health. 
The flow of Qi (energy) can be disturbed either through external trauma, such as an injury, or internal trauma such as depression or stress, or even just a sedentary lifestyle. When the body is energetically out of balance, this is when symptoms like aches and pain start to occur and we start to experience a state of "disease". Wherever you feel pain or tightness, your energetic circulation is stagnant, or even blocked. Stagnation is the root of injury or illness. Qigong meditation can increase the quantity of your Qi (energy) and improve the quality of your circulation.
Qi-gong translates from Chinese to Energy-Work. Qigong meditation creates balance in the body, both physically and energetically, by improving the flow of energy that circulates through the body in the meridians. We all have a "life force", Qi (energy) within all our trillions of cells, allowing them to function. Qi also regulates physical, emotional, mental and spiritual stability. Qi (ki in Japanese) maintains a homeostatic balance in your body.
Thank you for downloading our app! We are striving to make the best possible video apps available.
Sincerely,
The team at YMAA Publication Center, Inc.
(Yang‚Äôs Martial Arts Association)

Qigong meditation can increase the quantity of your Qi (energy) and improve the quality of your circulation.
Qi-gong translates from Chinese to Energy-Work. Qigong meditation creates balance in the body, both physically and energetically, by improving the flow of energy that circulates through the body in the meridians. We all have a "life force", Qi (energy) within all our trillions of cells, allowing them to function. Qi also regulates physical, emotional, mental and spiritual stability. Qi (ki in Japanese) maintains a homeostatic balance in your body.
Thank you for downloading our app! We are striving to make the best possible video apps available.
Sincerely,
The team at YMAA Publication Center, Inc.
(Yang‚Äôs Martial Arts Association)

description: Exercise can help ease arthritis pain ‚Äì but which one is best? The answer is as unique as you are. Your Exercise Solution tool provides a personalized exercise plan. title: TRACK + REACT
description:
Update: Our latest release has fixed the bug related to some users receiving an invalid email address warning when signing up. 

Discover the impact of your daily activities on your arthritis pain with TRACK + REACT. Track your nutrition, fitness, sleep, medication and mood and compare it to your arthritis pain in the Arthritis Impact graph.
 
TRACK + REACT Features:
- Understand which activities are impacting your arthritis pain
- Input your information in a secure environment
- Identify trends over time in the Arthritis Impact graph
- Use the web application (www.arthritis.org/trackandreact) to print your Arthritis Impact graph to share with your health care provider.
- Find advice and tips from the experts you trust at the Arthritis Foundation

Feedback from Users:
‚ÄúThe graph is extremely helpful.  It quantifies what I do and how this impacts my life.  Otherwise I just have a vague idea that I'm either feeling OK or not.  This shows concretely how I can impact how I feel.‚Äù
 
‚ÄúThis is an AWESOME tool and exactly what I need to be working with to help myself manage my life and especially health and well-being.‚Äù

title: RA Healthline
description:
You‚Äôre not alone, even if living with rheumatoid arthritis sometimes makes it seem that way. There‚Äôs a whole world of people living with rheumatoid arthritis just like you, waiting to connect and lend support.

Whether you‚Äôre newly diagnosed or a seasoned vet, you can meet others who understand exactly what you‚Äôre going through because they‚Äôve been there too.

Our mission is to empower people to live beyond their condition through compassion, support, and knowledge. From one-to-one chats to group discussions, we make connecting easy. This is a safe place to find and receive advice, to seek and offer support, and to discover the latest news and research updates curated, just for you.

HOW IT WORKS

Feed Your Soul 
Like all of your favorite social networks, we‚Äôve designed an activity feed to connect you with other members, like you, living with rheumatoid arthritis. We pride ourselves on making RA Healthline a safe and secure space where you can join live discussions, connect one-to-one, and read the latest news and wellness articles about your condition.

Live Discussions with RA Community Leaders
Gain advice and share whatever is on your mind in any one of our groups. It‚Äôs a great way to swap stories, ask questions, and share ideas while meeting others in the community. Five nights a week, join our RA Healthline guide and experts in the community as they lead live discussions in one of these groups:
General
Pain Management
Medication and Treatments
Flares and Remission
Alternative Therapies
Escape From RA
Lifestyle
Mental and Emotional Health
Navigating Healthcare
Daily Life
Relationships
Work
Diagnosis
Symptoms
Complications


Meet Your Match
Let us connect you with a new member from our community every day. We‚Äôll recommend members to you based on your treatment plan, lifestyle interests, and needs. Browse member profiles and request to connect with anyone from our community, even instantly, with members listed as ‚ÄúOnline now.‚Äù

Connect Anytime, Anywhere
Access support with ease from your Members screen. Check and send messages, see who‚Äôs online, and get notified when a new message comes in, all so you‚Äôll never miss a thing.

Discover the World of Rheumatoid Arthritis
Get handpicked wellness and news stories reviewed by Healthline‚Äôs team of medical professionals delivered to you each week. Stay informed about new treatments, what‚Äôs trending, and the latest in clinical trials. Find ways to nurture your body, mind, and spirit for a new kind of support.


ABOUT HEALTHLINE

Healthline Media is the top ranked health publisher and number 44 on Comscore‚Äôs Top 100 Property rankings. Across all of its properties, Healthline Media publishes each month up to 1,000 scientifically accurate yet reader-friendly articles authored by more than 120 writers and reviewed by more than 100 doctors, clinicians, nutritionists, and other experts. The company‚Äôs repository contains more than 70,000 articles, each updated with current protocol.

More than 200 million people worldwide and 86 million people in the U.S. visit Healthline‚Äôs sites each month, according to Google Analytics and Comscore, respectively.

title: RheumaHelper
description:
** The award-winning mobile tool for rheumatologists **

** Won "Good Practice 2016" the highest award by the leading Slovenian medical publication **
** Named a Top Rheumatoid Arthritis App of 2015, 2016, 2017, and 2018 by Healthline **

RheumaHelper is a mobile rheumatology assistant. It provides a complete toolbox of disease activity calculators and classification criteria the informed rheumatologist can reference during day-to-day work. Easy to use and always with you on your mobile phone, RheumaHelper is the perfect tool for rheumatologists.

** Verified content based on published research **

The validity of the content in the application is checked by Prof. Matija Tom≈°iƒç, M.D., Ph.D., head of the Dept. of Rheumatology, and ≈Ωiga Rotar, M.D., rheumatologist at the Dept. of Rheumatology, both at the University Clinical Centre in Ljubljana, Slovenia.

Included classifications:
‚Äî Adult Still's disease [Cush]
‚Äî Adult Still's disease [Yamaguchi]
‚Äî Antiphospholipid syndrome
‚Äî Arthralgia suspicious for progression to RA [2016 EULAR]
‚Äî Axial spondyloarthritis
‚Äî Beh√ßet‚Äôs Disease (ICBD)
‚Äî Fibromyalgia [2016 ACR]
‚Äî Gout [2015 ACR/EULAR]
‚Äî Gout [2014]
‚Äî Idiopathic inflammatory myopathies specification [2017 ACR/EULAR]

title: Atlas of Rheumatoid Arthritis
description:
Atlas of Rheumatoid Arthritis- Animated Videos collection

The Atlas of Rheumatoid Arthritis ‚ÄìAnimated Videos collection, is a comprehensive collection of videos and images pertaining to disabling, autoimmune disease that affects the joints. The Animated Atlas is an excellent reference and an invaluable resource for effective presentations and lectures.

Focus Animated Atlas series is a collection of authentic animation videos and images covering the key mechanisms, drug interactions and treatment process of a given disease condition. Created with the expertise of internationally reputed opinion leaders, these incredible animation videos accompanied by audio make it easier to perceive and understand the cellular world, metabolism, and body functions. The animations in this application simplify the understanding of biological processes and their mechanisms of action using visual media that is particularly well suited for the science of medicine. The high quality animations take the viewer on a virtual tour of the human system through accurate visuals to effortlessly understand chronic diseases and their mechanisms of action, and management including drug interactions.

title: TYPES OF ARTHRITIS
description:
Types of Arthritis - Nearly any joint in the body can become affected by different types of arthritis, resulting in pain, stiffness, and swelling, and other joint-related symptoms such as redness, warmth and tenderness.

Arthritis is an umbrella term meaning ‚Äújoint inflammation‚Äù, encompassing more than 100 diseases of the joints1, and is the most common cause of disability in the United States affecting approximately 46 million adults, which is nearly 1 in 5 adults, and 300,000 children.

If left untreated, this combination of symptoms can lead to immobility and difficulty in performing everyday tasks, or potentially more severe results.

Treatment for any type of arthritis begins with a proper diagnosis; an early diagnosis is often the key to long-term success in treatment. Treatment plans will be different for each patient, but they often include a combination of exercise programs, physical therapy, and medications. Each plan should aim to help control pain while maintaining mobility and preventing irreversible damage in the joints.

Arthritis is not a selective disease, affecting men and women, children and adults. It is also not just a disease of the elderly: more than half of patients suffering from arthritis are under 65 years of age. The specific causes, symptoms, and treatments will vary depending on the individual and the type of arthritis.

Install Types of Arthritis app and learn more now.

title: Knee Pain Relieving Exercises
description:
As an orthopaedic surgeon i come across many people who suffer from KNEE PAIN. In majority of the cases , the simple exercises can do wonders. Though it takes a time (approx. 2 months) before before the effect of exercises are appreciated. 

OSTEOARTHRITIS,  RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS, MENISCAL INJURY, AFTER KNEE REPLACEMENT, patients shall be benefited with these exercises. 

why we had developed this application :
1) Lot of exercises given on internet but difficult to TRUST as they are being propagated by techies without knowledge of knee biomechanics
2) many a times visit to a physio centre is not possible due to daily busy schedule
3) we tend to forget things when not carried out regularly, so a handout is easy
4) PRECAUTIONS are all we ask from our doctors, but many a times we forget to tell one or the other precaution
5) there were languages issues in my part of the world so i had translated it in HINDI AND PUNJABI. 

THE MOBILE APP IS FREE OF COST, THERE ARE NO PERMISSIONS, NO ADS, LOW ON SPACE(6 MB),ETC.

The mobile application has been specifically designed for people suffering from knee pain or arthritis of knee joint. it shall help in strengthening the muscles and decrease the knee pain markedly thus avoiding the need for knee replacement in selected cases.

title: Treatment of arthritis
description:
What is arthritis?
Arthritis is an inflammation of the joints. It can affect one joint or multiple joints. There are more than 100 different types of arthritis, with different causes and treatment methods. Two of the most common types are osteoarthritis (OA) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

The symptoms of arthritis usually develop over time, but they may also appear suddenly. Arthritis is most commonly seen in adults over the age of 65, but it can also develop in children, teens, and younger adults. Arthritis is more common in women than men and in people who are overweight.

title: Manage My Pain
description:
Chronic pain affects 1 in 5 individuals. It can be hard to explain to friends, family, and doctors. It can feel like it's taking control of your life and your mental health. Learn to conquer your chronic pain. Manage My Pain helps you and others better understand what you are going through. It has helped thousands of people with conditions like fibromyalgia, headaches, arthritis, or back pain better understand their symptoms and provide evidence of their pain for their doctors, insurance companies, or government agencies. Manage My Pain was created in partnership with industry-leading pain researchers - your doctor will actually read the reports from our app! Our daily reflections help people focus on their meaningful activities as opposed to the limitations created by their pain.

Manage My Pain will help you:
‚Ä¢ Record how you're feeling: Easily describe your pain in less than 30 seconds
‚Ä¢ Understand your unique pain criteria: Fully customizable options with each pain record let you identify factors such as how your pain feels, what the factors made the pain worse, which medications help you with your pain, and many more
‚Ä¢ Reflect on your day: Take your mind off pain and record activities that are meaningful to you
‚Ä¢ Highlight patterns and trends: Charts and graphs describe your results and get more powerful over time
‚Ä¢ Track how well your meds are working: Add any medication to your profile and mark if it helps manage your pain
‚Ä¢ Describe your pain to your doctor: Summarize your pain through unique reports that your doctor will actually read

Developed for patients suffering from and care-givers or medical professionals treating: 
‚Ä¢ arthritis & rheumatism
‚Ä¢ cancer 
‚Ä¢ chronic pain
‚Ä¢ headaches & migraines 
‚Ä¢ fibromyalgia 

Use this pain management app to replace your hand-written: 
‚Ä¢ pain diary 
‚Ä¢ pain journal 
‚Ä¢ pain log 
‚Ä¢ pain tracker 

The Pro version adds the ability to view or report on more than the last 30 days. Reports are free to generate, however, those that contain advanced sections may require an additional credit to be purchased. An optional monthly subscription can be purchased so that an unlimited number of reports with advanced sections may be generated without the need for credits.

comments: **UPDATE** after receiving response from customer support (which was expedient and right on the money for what I needed). I absolutely LOVE this app!!! (upgrade from 4 stars to 5!!) Once I was clear on how to use app, I really appreciate having somewhere to log my daily concerns. I do wish there were more specific body parts, but I LOVE that u can put notes in and be more specific there.

Really great free app with incredibly reasonably priced premium levels (although I've not needed to upgrade from free yet so can't comment on their pros & cons). You can add your own pain descriptors and chart things like mental fog and fatigue. It doesn't take too long to fill out and you can easily change the entry date. The only thing I "don't like" is that it defaults to filling out the daily reflection rather than pain when opening the app. Definitely recommend for chronic pain sufferers!

Really useful for tracking pain, and I like all the options they give you for stuff. Plus you can make your own! I just started tracking my pain and this app has helped give a visual of how much I neglect to address my physical health. Glad I stumbled upon this :)

I started using this app because I know I will need a lengthy history to be diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I like how easy this app is to use and record my daily symptoms and over all how Im feeling. This app is super helpful.
Love this. Most apps that track your activities etc are very limited without subscribing but this one has a lot of free features and is a great way of keeping track of patterns

title: Knee Osteoarthritis Exercises
description:
Knee arthritis is a painful condition that affects the knee joint. Over time, it can disrupt your gait, your knee muscles become weak, and they also prepare the ground for other problems. You can get rid of your pain and make your knee healthier by applying exercises that help alleviate knee osteoarthritis in our mobile app. Performing these movements regularly helps prevent knee calcification from progressing and different knee problems.

With the advancement of age, excessive burden on the knee triggers the formation of knee calcification, which causes problems as the knee pain. Also, since knee muscles are weakened, it creates difficulty in climbing stairs and walking for a long time. The exercises that relieve knee pain in our mobile app include strengthening, stretching and isometric contraction movements. These are therapies with therapeutic effect, which also function as a series of relief in cases such as meniscus tear, knee pain and ligament injury. As the knee muscles strengthen, the weight on your knee will decrease, blood circulation will increase and it will help the knee arthritis to heal.

Download our knee osteoarthritis exercises app now. It will be enough to set aside 15-20 minutes a day to practice the movements shown here.

title: Arthritis Guide
description:
Arthritis pain: Arthritis is a group of painful and degenerative conditions marked by inflammation in the joints that causes stiffness and pain. Osteoarthritis, the most common type of arthritis, gets worse with age and is caused by wear and tear over the years. Rheumatoid arthritis is caused by the immune system attacking the joints as if they were foreign tissues. Because of this, rheumatoid arthritis is classified as an autoimmune disease.

Doctors traditionally treat arthritis with anti-inflammatory medications and painkillers. However, some medications cause side effects, and a natural approach to pain relief is becoming more popular. Remember to consult your doctor before trying these natural remedies.

1. Lose weight
Your weight can make a big impact on the amount of pain you experience from arthritis. Extra weight puts more pressure on your joints ‚Äî especially your knees, hips, and feet.

Reducing the stress on your joints by losing weight will improve your mobility, decrease pain, and prevent future damage to your joints.

2. Get more exercise
There are more benefits to exercise than just weight loss. Regular movement helps to maintain flexibility in your joints. Weight-bearing exercises such as running and walking can be damaging. Instead, try low-impact exercises such as water aerobics or swimming to flex your joints without adding further stress.

3. Use hot and cold therapy
Simple hot and cold treatments can make a world of difference when it comes to arthritis pain. Long, warm showers or baths ‚Äî especially in the morning ‚Äî help ease stiffness in your joints. Use an electric blanket or moist heating pad at night to keep your joints loose.

Cold treatments are best for relieving joint pain, swelling, and inflammation. Wrap a gel ice pack or a bag of frozen vegetables in a towel and apply it to painful joints for quick relief.

4. Try acupuncture
Acupuncture is an ancient Chinese medical treatment that involves inserting thin needles into specific points on your body. This is supposed to reroute energies and restore balance in your body. Acupuncture is the most researched complementary therapy and is recommended by the World Health Organization for treatment of over 100 different conditions.

It is thought that acupuncture has the ability to reduce arthritis pain. If you want to explore this treatment method, be sure to find a licensed and certified acupuncturist in your state.

5. Use meditation to cope with pain
Meditation and relaxation techniques may be able to help you reduce pain from arthritis by reducing stress and enabling you to cope with it better. According to the National Institutes of Health (NIH), studies have found that the practice of mindfulness meditation is helpful for some people with painful joints. Researchers also found that those with depression and arthritis benefitted the most from meditation. When stress is reduced, inflammation and thus swelling and pain drop.

Arthritis Guide Main Features:

title: PainScale - Free Chronic Pain Tracker Diary
description:
The Popular pain tracking app for iOS and Android !.  Awarded one of the Best Fibromyalgia apps of 2019 ‚Äì by Healthline. Join over 100,000 chronic pain patients who manage and scale their pain and symptoms with Painscale; the highly-ranked pain tracker health app on the web! 

The PainScale app offers a FREE suite of pain management tools to help chronic pain patients to scale their pain.
Manage a Pain Tracker Diary!

Created with input from doctors and chronic pain patients, the Pain Diary acts as a pain tracker and organizes all the information the patient needs in one accessible location. With over 800 organized articles, health tips, exercises, information on pain meditation programs and treatment options, pain management becomes easier.   	

PainScale provides personalized pain management education for users. Trusted content. is available to help people understand their symptoms and better manage their condition. By providing insights to a community of other patients who share their treatment information, PainScale helps patients discover information about treatment options that may work for their condition.
PainScale is an easy and simple to use, pain and health tracker app.
 
Features

 ‚Ä¢ Pain Diary ‚Äì log and track your pain to track triggers, pain intensity, symptoms, treatments, medications, activity, mood, and sleep digital scale.
 ‚Ä¢ Pain Reports ‚Äì get and send summary and detailed reports for better patient-physician communication, you can take all the information you need from the Pain Diary.
 ‚Ä¢ Insights - personal tips to help you discover information about treatment options to better manage your condition
‚Ä¢ Trusted Content ‚Äì get FREE access to a searchable library of articles, videos, and meditations to help find pain relief,

comments: Outstanding App to help you track pain types, areas and symptoms. Able to show different pain types in different areas of the body. I love that you can add notes as well in journal entries! The reports are fantastic and easy to email with you deciding the custom time span. The insights that can show correlation between activity, weather, and other triggers really helps. Love that I can attach to Samsung Health and thus my sleep, EKGs and pulse rate, BP, etc to see correlations! Great App!!!

I've been using this app for months now and I still love it. It's easy to use, it syncs with my Samsung Health, and the helpful articles and tips are normally quick reads and informative, and it has easy adjustments in the settings. I highly recommend this app.

So far it's a good useful app. One suggestion. Love to have ability to add multiple entries during the day without altering my earlier input.This will help me better track triggers and effectiveness of the different things I do to help alleviate my pain. Also, there needs to be room for more than one entry for doc location,insurance& pain on opposite side of the body.If I have pain in back of legs and knees, the figure turns around but deleted the previous tagged body pain location.

I've only been using this app for a short time but so far it is the best that I have tried. I have chronic pain with various etiologies and the app has a detailed pain map that allows me to more precisely record my pain. The automatic time stamp is a great feature as is the ability to link it to my Fitbit for superior insights that corralate sleep and activity to pain levels. Im holding off on that 5th star because I am still learning the app and all of its functionality.

The PainScale app has been great! I am able to track my whole day. Pain, food and anything else I need. I have added my glucose readings in the notes. I am also able to put on there my activities making me able to see any issues and also my progress. Thank you!

title: Arthritis Killer
description:
Thousands now experience relief from arthritis who never thought they could!

There is relief available for arthritis, and I want you to realize it.You probably came to this page because you are tired of your bones, joints and limbs giving you the kind of pain that aspirin and medicine don't seem to provide any relief for.

I used to experience the same kind of pain on an everyday basis, and know exactly what you are going through. I know what it is to wake up in the morning with pain so intense that you don't want to get out of bed.

I remember the days that I wouldn't leave the house because my body was racked with pain, every time I moved. It was depressing.

Inside this course, you will learn by the hand and lead you step by step through getting relief from those crippling moments that keep you from enjoying your life.

You'll know the steps you need to take on a daily basis so that you can make your arthritis manageable enough to live an energetic and dynamic life. That's my part to show you those things.

Then let's explore what you are going to learn over the next 7 lessons:

Instant Arthritis Relief Is It Possible
Common Types of Arthritis and Treatment Options
Foods That Can Help Arthritis Sufferers
Arthritis Pain Daily Tips to Gain Control
Arthritis and Supplements What You Need to Know
Cayenne Pepper and Arthritis Relief
And so much more...

title: Living With RA
description:
Download the Living With RA app if you have enrolled on your clinic‚Äôs Living With Rheumatoid Arthritis platform. 

Living With RA app connects people to their RA consultants in order to track condition activity, flare-ups and support awareness of personal trends and triggers. 

Designed with rheumatology consultants working in the NHS.

Living With RA is by invitation only. 

----

Living With RA aims to help you better understand the state of your RA with condition tracking through flare-up reporting, outcome questionnaires and educational articles from the National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS).

It is suitable for anyone who is seeing a specialist rheumatologist for problems connected to rheumatoid arthritis. 

Living With RA is simple to use, informative, sends reminders to complete questionnaires and has helpful visual records of your condition activity to support awareness of personal trends and triggers.

Features include:
-	Flare-up reporting
-	Patient report outcome measures (PROMs) questionnaires such as HAQ-DI and RAPID3
-	Receive reminders for PROMs recommended by your RA consultant
-	Educational articles from the National Rheumatoid Arthritis Society (NRAS)

The Living With RA app and the Living With Rheumatoid Arthritis platform comply with the NHS Information Governance requirements.

-----

To find out if you are able to access the Living With RA app, ask your clinician if they have the Living With Rheumatoid Arthritis platform.

Or let your clinic know you‚Äôre interested in signing up here: livingwith.health/requestlivingwithra

title: DAS28 - Rheumatoid Arthritis
description:
DAS 28 - Disease Activity Score Calculator for Rheumatoid Arthritis.
DAS28, a modified version of the original DAS, is a quantitative measure of disease activity used to monitor the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis. DAS28, which stands for "disease activity score," is calculated using a formula that includes the number of tender joints and swollen joints (28 joints maximum). DAS28 is not only useful for assessing patients in clinical practice but for clinical trials as well.

You can calculate the DAS28 ESR (default) or DAS28 CRP

title: Elsa ‚Äì Impact your rheumatoid arthritis
description:
Elsa helps you understand how your habits and your medical treatment affect your rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

With Elsa you can do research on yourself! By logging your habits you will be able to better understand how your choices affect your illness and your well-being. Your experiences will also be used to help others with rheumatoid arthritis ‚Äì and wider research. By using the app, you help not only yourself, but others living with the same illness too. 

How are you feeling today? Enter your symptoms and information about your well-being in a few simple steps.

Log treatment and habits. Choose what you want to monitor, such as physical activity or smoking.

Find out what makes you feel good! See how your habits can change and affect your symptoms.

Use the insights and data that you think are relevant as support when you meet doctors or healthcare staff.

Elsa is a CE marked medical technology product that is registered with the Swedish Medical Products Agency.

Elsa is currently being co-developed by designers, developers, researchers, healthcare providers and patients across Sweden.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description:
Choose This not That for Rheumatoid Arthritis. Inside this colorful app, you will find easy to follow suggestions on how to improve your health through nutrition and the food choices you make every day. This app provides comprehensive and actionable nutrition guidelines for how to prevent and combat RA and its symptoms. If you rather tackle health issues through proper nutrition and lifestyle changes then this app is for you! Last data update: Nov. 2019.

A number of powerful, unique and interactive features make this app so different and superior to others in the market:

‚Ä¢ Is this food good for me? This feature answers the common question about suitability of various food items for your personal situation. And it does so in an easy to understand and colorful graphic form.

‚Ä¢ Health issues often come our way in groups of two or more. They are often caused by other health complications or result in other illnesses and risks. It is for that reason, that we have included separate guidelines for those who might be at risk with any of the following common conditions along with RA:
 
- Anemia (iron deficiency)
- Depression
- Excess body weight or obesity
- Heart disease
- High blood pressure
- High cholesterol
- Joints well-being
- Osteoporosis 
- Stress
- Vitamin D deficiency

Also included are comprehensive guidelines on autoimmunity including detoxification, anti-inflammation, leaky gut and Microbiome health diets.

‚Ä¢ Top-5 recommendations on what to eat/do, and what not to.

‚Ä¢ Recipes. Most popular recipes on leading web sites.

‚Ä¢ Food Suggestions. The best food choices within a food group, based on your personal profile. An extremely valuable tool when at restaurants or when grocery shopping. Also included are suggestions on appropriate life style choices, alternative therapies and herbal remedies, when such options are promising and available to you.

‚Ä¢ ACTIONABLE information on what is good, what is bad, and what is neutral for your condition(s). We single out specific food items, and give you an ordered list of helpful and harmful foods within each food group. 

Suggestions presented in this app are based on the content licensed from Personal Remedies, LLC. The primary sources used by Personal Remedies are US government sources such as USDA (US Department of Agriculture), NIH (National Institute of Health) agencies, and leading clinics & universities.

Personal Remedies is the publisher of the largest collection of health and nutrition apps for chronic conditions in the market, based in metro-Boston, home to the highest ranking healthcare providers and academic institutions in the world.

This app is updated by our team on an ongoing basis. Updates happen seamlessly, and do NOT require frequent inconvenient downloads.

‚ÄúThis technology was developed using the most current clinical evidence-based information that is available in the US. Behind this technology there is a team of expert clinicians, scientists, endocrinologists, oncologists, and other specialists who are passionate about bridging the gap between expert knowledge and the patient.‚Äú 
Katya Tsaioun, PhD, Nutrition, Tufts University; L.D.N.

 ‚ÄúProper nutrition and other alternative treatments show great promise in preventing and treating many of the illnesses that we deal with every day. I encourage all my patients to follow appropriate nutrition and research other options for themselves. The Choose This Not That series are an excellent step towards improving people‚Äôs knowledge in this area.‚Äù
Shahin Tabatabaei, MD
Mass General Hospital; Harvard Medical School

‚ÄúAs an orthopedic surgeon, I love that my patients stay engaged in their health and actively see what foods they should consume and avoid, using their smart device.‚Äù
Bruce Gomberg, MD
Orthopedic Surgeon

title: OPERAS Arthritis
description:
OPERAS will help you monitor how active your arthritis is, your symptoms and mood, along with your physical activity, to get the whole picture of your health.

OPERAS also helps in other ways, too, by allowing you to keep track of your medications, record notes about your health, and create action plans to assist you in reaching your health goals. It also helps you to set and track your physical activity goals by capturing and displaying information collected by Fitbit, a wearable activity device. This information can help you better understand how your physical activity relates to how you feel overall.

If you have been diagnosed with Rheumatoid Arthritis, you may be eligible to participate in this study and use the OPERAS tool. Please contact Johnathan Tam at 604-207-4027 or at operas@arthritisresearch.ca for more details.

It also helps you to set and track your physical activity goals by capturing and displaying information collected by Fitbit, a wearable activity device. This information can help you better understand how your physical activity relates to how you feel overall.

If you have been diagnosed with Rheumatoid Arthritis, you may be eligible to participate in this study and use the OPERAS tool. Please contact Johnathan Tam at 604-207-4027 or at operas@arthritisresearch.ca for more details.
summary: OPERAS helps people with rheumatoid arthritis self manage their disease.
recentChanges: Changed the keyboard type to avoid spelling suggestions for participant IDs.

title: LiveWith Arthritis
description:
Get a grip on your arthritis!

eTreatMD LiveWith Arthritis is the very best digital companion for arthritis sufferers that allows you to take control of your painful arthritis flare-ups and get your life back. With our simple touch interface, you can track your joint pain, diet, mood and physical activities.  

Use powerful imaging to create a visual history of your condition. Simply take a picture of your hand and it accurately measures your fingers, joints and other arthritis symptoms in less than a minute. These images and measurements can be used to monitor your progress and shared with your doctor for a more effective consultation.

Want to find out if that new diet is helping out? Does that new cream you're using work better than the painkiller you were on last month? Unlike other health apps, LiveWith's unique reporting system does more than just graph your pain and lifestyle factors over time - it performs a scientific evaluation, based on your personal inputs, to simply tell you what provided relief and what didn't. 

We want to help you identify treatments and activities that suit you best, potentially save you time and money in the future.

LiveWith Arthritis was designed by arthritis sufferers for arthritis sufferers. eTreatMD is one of the Global Digital Health Top 100 and our app won the CATAAlliance Telus Health Outstanding Product Achievement Award.

comments: I was part of the original kickstarter (or whichever it was) years ago and have had the app since the beginning but not once in the 40 or so times I've tried it has it actually worked. I've watched the videos at least 6 times. I've tried and tried over several years, it gives upload success then immediately errors on every image uploaded and with the camera it never gives me a green light too take the photo, no matter how closely i place my hand to their template. I've reinstalled but no success
Helpful app
Great for tracking environmental factors that may contribute to my pain
Award winning app with good reason
I will using this along with my girlfriend!

title: Arthritis App 1
description:
Think you can‚Äôt stop that arthritis pain? Great news! You can act now. Get 10 super easy and effective arthritis pain relief tips from arthritis experts and make your life with arthritis a little easier now.



Protect your joints. Don‚Äôt keep your joints in the same position for a prolonged period of time. Balance your rest and work throughout the day. Use the strongest joints available for the job.



Stretch it. Stretching should be part of every arthritis patient‚Äôs daily routine. A good stretch helps prevent injuries by warming up muscles and tendons which are more limber and less likely to tear. Spend at least 10 minutes each day stretching, and work each major muscle group.¬†



Cool it down. Stop physical activity. Rest in a cool/shaded environment. Spray with a mist of cool water or wrap an ice pack or cold compress in a towel and apply it to reduce arthritis pain and swelling.¬†



Get moving. Exercise can help reduce joint pain and stiffness and increases flexibility and muscle strength. It can also help with weight control, stress management, and make you feel better overall. The Arthritis Foundation also offers water exercise and other classes.¬†



Get a massage. Massage therapy can relieve your pain, soothe stiff sore muscles, reduce inflammation and swelling. Make sure you use oil or cream on your fingers to make it mroe gentle. Work the area for five to ten minutes a day if possible.



Keep your weight in balance. Being overweight, even just moderately, impacts weightbearing joints and can increase the pain of arthritis. Studies have indicated that losing extra weight lowers the risk for developing osteoarthritis of the knee. Losing weight can help slow the progression of arthritis too.



Get a diagnosis. If you are experiencing symptoms like pain, stiffness, swelling for more than 1 weeks, you should consider seeing your doctor and getting a diagnosis. Remember that there are more than 100 types of arthritis. It is important to get the specific diagnosis for the type of arthritis you have.



Take your medication the right way. Don‚Äôt stop taking your medication just because you feel it is not working. Check with your doctor first. You need to understand that it may take several days to several months for a medication to become effective.



Look out for new options. Recently FDA has approved some new drugs for osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis and other arthritis diseases. If feel that the current medication doesn‚Äôt work well, check with your doctor about possible new options.



Keep educating yourself. It is important to learn something new about arthritis. Find some good websites online and subscribe to their newsletter if they have it. Join one of two active online arthritis communities like forums or bulletin board. Never hesitate to see your doctors and ask questions.

title: SMART Arthritis
description:
Claim independence and improve your mobility with SMA¬ÆT Arthritis, a revolutionary app that accurately pinpoints the area of inflammation from knee arthritis to develop a customized pain management and treatment plan providing with a precise tool to identify the zone for intensive medicine application.

SMA¬ÆT Arthritis is a leading edge solution that acts as in-home monitoring for knee arthritis. With easy operation and heat zone imaging, arthritis sufferers can now manage their inflammation and arthritis pain right from the comfort of their own homes. Not only is it used to identify the exact location of inflammation to serve as a roadmap to applying anti-inflammatory medicines, the app also helps with the management of rheumatoid arthritis pain (and other arthritis pain) by structuring the right treatment plan based on inflammation stemming from an individual‚Äôs unique diet and physical activity with its built in diary system. In addition to real-time monitoring, SMA¬ÆT Arthritis is an efficient way to correct current physical activities and determine proper physical exercises and foods that don‚Äôt cause inflammation in the knee, offering improved insight into developing a customized form of treatment, like the best arthritis medicine to use or which home remedies for arthritis are having the most impact.

SMA¬ÆT Arthritis eliminates the guesswork and pinpoints the exact source of knee pain.

Inflammation in the knee is the cause of pain, but the location of the pain is oftentimes different that where the actual inflammation is located. SMA¬ÆT Arthritis offers a safe, efficient and easy way to pinpoint the exact area where inflammation occurs in order to provide individuals with the accurate place to apply anti-inflammatory medicines. A red zone will appear on the imaging, indicating where to apply your gel or cream to target the source of inflammation and maximize your treatment.

An arthritis diet plan including rheumatoid arthritis diet plan is an important element in reducing inflammation and living a well-rounded life. Different foods can have an impact on an inflammation, which is why tracking your arthritis inflammation with SMA¬ÆT Arthritis can offer greater insight into your health and lifestyle. If you are suffering from arthritis, the foods to avoid list may differ based on your level of arthritis and overall diet.

SMA¬ÆT Arthritis offers a unique approach to arthritis pain management through thermal images that identify the area of inflammation. The app serves as a real-time, interactive way of managing inflammation from knee arthritis and can create a personal health care diary that tracks improvement over time, adding valuable insight into an individual‚Äôs overall treatment therapy. Every individual‚Äôs pain management plan is unique and SMA¬ÆT Arthritis allows for the selection of the most effective treatment plan, saving money and avoiding unnecessary side effects stemming from inaccurate treatment options.

Similar to glucometers apps or blood pressure apps which have improved the lives of individuals around the world, SMA¬ÆT Arthritis works to create the same level of independence and authority over one's‚Äô health care. SMA¬ÆT Arthritis allows individuals to take an active role in the management of their arthritis knee pain. The app helps support an independent, mobile life, giving freedom to individuals who would otherwise be debilitated and isolated by their condition. It also helps reduce overall pain by identifying dietary changes and remedies as a means of reducing inflammation.

Compatibility and Use

Apple Health app (requires iOS 9) integration, if activated: reads daily step count.
The SMA¬ÆT Arthritis sensor attaches to smartphone through an audio jack, for ease of use.

Legal

SMA¬ÆT Arthritis is not intended for diagnostics purposes and should only be used after receiving a diagnosis "knee arthritis" by a doctor. SMA¬ÆT Arthritis technology and the SMA¬ÆT Arthritis trademark are patented in EU, Japan, China etc.

title: How to Relieve Joint Pain
description:
Your joints endure an incredible amount of stress. They connect your bones, support your weight and above all, allow you to move. Though your joints are designed to cope with all of the stress you place on them, sometimes they suffer from wear and tear, and the resulting joint pain, otherwise known as arthralgia, can be extremely uncomfortable.

Joint pain (such as in your knees and hips) can be caused by a number of different factors, which range from wounds, trauma, disease, strains and sprains, bursitis, tendonitis, or even osteoporosis. Arthritis can also cause joint pain, but it is important to remember that joint pain often differs from person to person. There are, however, a number of things you can do to temporarily alleviate the pain, as well as prevent it. Here are ten ways to alleviate and prevent arthralgia, according to MedlinePlus

title: Arthritis Bike Classic
description:
Fundraise on the go with our Arthritis Bike Classic mobile app. Update your page, send emails, and check your progress ‚Äì all from the palm of your hand. The Arthritis Bike Classic  app is a great tool to track your fundraising progress, and to keep current on all event news! 

Please note: The Arthritis Bike Classic Android app is only available to current event registrants. If you haven't registered yet for this years event, please go to https://www.arthritis.org/get-involved/bike-events/ and register for an event.

Please note: The Arthritis Bike Classic Android app is only available to current event registrants. If you haven't registered yet for this years event, please go to https://www.arthritis.org/get-involved/bike-events/ and register for an event.
summary: Do your fundraising on the go with your Arthritis Bike Classic application.

title: Psoriaisis & Psoriatic Apps Book
description:
Do You Suffer From the Itching and Scaling of Psoriasis?
Or the Chronic Agony of Psoriatic Arthritis?
If so you are not ALONE!
A whopping three percent of the world‚Äôs populations suffer from either condition!
An incredible 56 million working hours are lost every year by psoriasis sufferers according to the National Psoriasis Foundation.
The drugs to manage psoriasis are expensive and have side effects!
Although the disease is not fatal it can be so annoying you wish you were dead!
That is why I wrote -
Natural Treatments for Psoriasis
and Psoriatic Arthritis

Dear Fellow Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis Sufferer -

I know you would not be on this page with me if you weren‚Äôt suffering from Psoriasis or its more serious and sometimes inevitable development into an excruciationg and chronic case of Psoriatic Arthritis.

Are these conditions affecting your life in these ways? 

Do you wear long sleeved or uncomfortably warm clothing to cover up the itchy scaly patches that cover your body from the psoriasis?
Is it painful to comb or brush your hair because of the dry sore and scaly patches on your scalp that often develop as part of the condition of psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis?
Are you afraid to shave your legs or armpits in case you trigger some kind of outbreak of lesions through the abrading of the razor blade?
Have you heard other people making fun of your "scales" behind your back?
Are you constantly vacuuming so others won‚Äôt notice your flaking skin?
Are you spending hundreds on natural products so your tender skin does not break out into embarrassing lesions?
Are you spending hundreds on special prescription creams and pills
Are you isolating and avoiding going out on dates because you are afraid you will gross your date out with your skin texture?
Do you suffer from unbearable itching that drives you crazy and drives others crazy too?
Are you losing sleep because of itching, the need to scratch and even bleeding from your psoriasis patches?
Does psoriasis on your hands make the simplest tasks such as washing dishes or wiping up painful for you?
Do you have the inflamed red psoriatic skin lesions around the joint area that are symptomatic of psoriatic arthritis?
Do you have pain and swelling in the joints that is excruciating in the morning?
Are your nails pitted or turning orange or ridged or developing strange twists and patterns?
Are your toenails or fingernails beginning to pull away from your nail beds giving your hands a disfigured appearance?
Do your joints feel warmer than other parts of your body - that might be due to your psoriasis becoming a case of psoriatic arthritis?
Do you have pains like tennis elbow in your elbow joint for no reason at all?
Do you have a numbness or a stunned feeling in your fingers or limbs?
Do you have a chronic pain in the neck, shoulder or upper back? Don‚Äôt ignore this symptom!

In fact, I stress that last symptom because it is the most insidious one when it comes to psoriatic arthritis! That is because it is so easy to ignore that as being just fatigue or muscle soreness when in reality it is actually a warning that lesions and patches of scaly skin might break out in the area.

I learned the awful way that I was just not suffering from ordinary garden variety back pain when my neck and back broke out in painful sores and became so painful to move that I had to stand in a hot shower for hours just trying to get the flexibility to get moving in the morning.
Do You Have The Symptoms Above and Have No Idea What to Do?
Then you need to read -
Natural Treatments for Psoriasis
and Psioriatic Arthritis

Now I know that I said that when I wrote this book that it was going to be about natural treatments. But I realize that there are many of you out there who just don‚Äôt know the basics.

title: Arthritis Digest
description:
Arthritis Digest magazine summarises the latest research in the arthritis arena making it essential reading for anyone affected by the painful condition. 

Informative, upbeat and packed full of news and reviews about drugs, pain relief, superfoods, products and services, each issue has a star celebrity interview and true stories. 

Arthritis Digest magazine informs readers and encourages them to learn, try new ideas and explore their options. You‚Äôll know what your doctor is talking about, what options are available to you and what‚Äôs around the corner in terms of new treatments. 

Take control of your arthritis ‚Äì with Arthritis Digest

---------------------------------


This is a free app download. Within the app users can purchase the current issue and back issues.
Subscriptions are also available within the application. A subscription will start from the latest issue.

Available subscriptions are:

12 months (6 Issues)

-The subscription will renew automatically unless cancelled more than 24 hours before the end of the current period. You will be charged for renewal within 24 hours of the end of the current period, for the same duration and at the current subscription rate for the product.
-You may turn off the auto-renewal of subscriptions through Google Play Account settings, however you are not able to cancel the current subscription during its active period.

Users can register for/ login to a pocketmags account in-app. This will protect their issues in the case of a lost device and allow browsing of purchases on multiple platforms. Existing pocketmags users can retrieve their purchases by logging into their account.

We recommend loading the app for the first time in a wi-fi area.

If you have any problems at all please do not hesitate to contact us: help@pocketmags.com
